definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: It was from her that Mr. Chen had learned the fine art of persuasion.
sentences.chinese: 老陳也就是從他奶奶那裏學來的勸導的藝術。

sentences.english: They provide the structure around which people understand and discuss persuasive design.
sentences.chinese: 他們提供了可供理解和討論勸導式設計的結構。

sentences.english: Teacher Li always patiently wises students who have made mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 李老師總是耐心勸導犯錯誤的學生。

sentences.english: Vomit fan's degree to teach the queen mommy this some kind of persuasion, feels heart one width.
sentences.chinese: 吐迷度教太后這一番勸導，頓覺心間一寬。

sentences.english: The teacher wised him to overcome the difficulties in his study.
sentences.chinese: 老師勸導他克服學習中的困難。

sentences.english: He will bring many of Israel's people back to the Lord their God.
sentences.chinese: 他要勸導許多以色列人回心轉意，歸順他們的上帝。

sentences.english: We are surrounded, on a day-to-day basis, by the exhortation to act.
sentences.chinese: 我們每天都被這些勸導我們行動的話語包圍着。

definition: use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
